main event: A civilian observed a tricolor light in the sky over Carlsbad, New Mexico after dusk on 13 May 1964.
interesting points: The object exhibited green, red, and yellow colors and was compared in size to the planet Venus., The object was observed for approximately 2 hours and 50 minutes., The light flickered more pronounced than typical stars., Initial sightings began when the observer was scanning the skies with binoculars., The object appeared to follow a celestial path and disappeared below the horizon.
sighted object: a tricolored light in the sky
witness description: One civilian youngster under 15, his father, a 25-year-old male, and an air traffic control specialist.
